UkrMap.title: We are a charitable organization — the Ukrainian Educational Foundation — dedicated to supporting hildren.Over 20,000 children are currently under our care. Since the beginning of the full-scale war, we have been arrying out humanitarian missions to the eastern regions of Ukraine. We help evacuate families, create educational spaces, and conduct workshops for children living in frontline “red zones.” Our special focus is on orphaned children living with elderly guardians of retirement age — currently, there are more than 100 such children in our care.
UkrMap.title_1: Our special focus is on orphaned children who live with guardians of retirement age. There are more than 100 such children under our care.
UkrMap.description_p1: Vladik is a boy who lost his mother in the war. He was evacuated from Lyman together with his grandmother. We found them housing, helped them adapt, and provided everything they needed.
UkrMap.description_p1a: But there are hundreds of children like Vladik — children who have lost their parents, but have not lost their right to warmth, safety, and love.
UkrMap.description_p2: It is for them that we are creating HOME — a space where they can live, learn, and receive medical and psychological support.
UkrMap.description_p3: Our mission is not just to provide a roof over their heads, but to create a true family for those who have been left alone.

ReadyHome.title: The HOME is ready! Now it’s time to set it up

ReadyHome.description_2: Renovations and preparations are currently underway so that children and their guardians can move into a safe home as soon as possible.

aboutProject.title: This is why the idea of the HOME Center for Children project was born.
aboutProject.description: This category of children and elderly people requires round-the-clock care. We began searching for models of similar centers to adopt the best practices.
aboutProject.teamInformation: Our team visited all well-known (and even lesser-known) shelters, rehabilitation centers, and care homes in Ukraine and Europe. And only one (!!!) truly stands out: Marta Levchenko's “City of Goodness”. It is the largest shelter in Ukraine, currently housing 300 mothers with children, two relocated orphanages, a hospice for children with cancer, and an animal shelter.

DevelopmentDIM.title: Development of the HOME project over the next 5 years
DevelopmentDIM.description: Currently, our foster care service focuses on families of fallen heroes, those in captivity, and those wounded, as well as children whose parents serve in the State Emergency Service and children of medical workers in the “red” zones. For these categories of families, we are developing (and it is already partially operational) a rehabilitation program. At the HOME Center, children with their mothers will be able to undergo 7- and 10-day rehabilitation courses with full board. Psychologists and group sessions will be available. We intend to obtain a medical license.

House.title: What will happen to the project next
House.description: For families of fallen heroes, those in captivity, or those who have been injured, as well as for children whose parents work in the State Emergency Service or are medical workers, the 'HOME' Center will offer a rehabilitation program. The center will have qualified psychologists and organized group sessions for support and recovery.
